THOUGHT-PROVOKING.Definition: Causing people to think seriously about something

TAME.Definition: To control something dangerous or powerful; domesticate

MISFORTUNE.Definition: Bad luck, or an unlucky event

UNPREDICTABLE.Definition: Likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly

GUIDANCE.Definition: Help and advice about how to do something or about how to deal with problems

DESPAIR.Definition: A feeling of being without hope or of not being able to improve a situation

SORROW.Definition: A feeling of deep sadness or regret

UPBRINGING.Definition: The treatment and instruction received by a child from its parents throughout its childhood

LONG-LOST.Definition: Used to refer to someone or something that you have not seen for a long time

INCREASE.Definition: To (make something) become larger in amount or size

MANUFACTURED.Definition: To produce goods in large numbers, usually in a factory using machines

RAGS.Definition: A torn piece of old cloth, used typically for cleaning things

COST-EFFECTIVE.Definition: Providing good value for the amount paid

TABOO.Definition: A subject, word, or action that is avoided for religious or social reasons

LAUGHING STOCK.Definition: Someone or something that seems stupid or silly, especially by trying to be serious or important and not succeeding

OSTRACIZE.Definition: Exclude (someone) from a society or group

ENABLE.Definition: To make someone able to do something, or to make something possible
